page.title: 07A VISIT TO THORPE MARKET
page.content: On our visit to the Market we had to park more than half a mile away and walk to it. There were many stalls selling clothes,shoes, vegetables, jewellery, china and house_hold stuff. There were others where you could buy electronic games, toys and books. On one stall there were some very old swords which were made of metal and were curved. There was one man with a microphone attached to him which he spoke through and it made his voice very loud. This man is called a barker. In the covered part of the market is an auctioneer and people were bidding for furniture and plants. A big crowd was standing round him and we had a job to see what was going on. Although there were a lot of people there, Thorpe Market isn't as busy or as big as Clacton Market.
